result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Tarran Smith

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mark Tarran Smith not in court, in custody.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court for Mark Tarran Smith.  
Prosecuting attorney Olivia Simmons in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Matter set for plea and sentencing.  Defendant has changed his mind and requests a final pretrial and jury trial date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Mark Tarran Smith in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Mark Tarran Smith in custody, appearing via zoom.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter scheduled for a bail hearing. Defense withdraws bail motion. Attorney Rebholz is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court, defendant Mark Tarran Smith not in court, in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing held via Zoom. HEARING HELD OFF THE RECORD. Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Rebholz has received discovery and is waiting on an offer.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Commissioner Orders Oral No Contact Order with BMM
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.

Defendant Mark Tarran Smith in court with Student Intern Ryan Birschbach under the supervision of attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Mark Tarran Smith in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mark Tarran Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. This hearing may be streamed live at the Court's discretion on  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
